content:
Rajesh Kannan said
For the past 2 months I've been using this Thunderbird android app. I don't understand why I keep getting multiple mails being received in my inbox of gmail and Yahoo accounts. I request you to kindly look into this matter. Rest all good with the email client.

I must admit that I use another mail client 'Aquamail' too. I have those same set of multiple email accounts wherein I receive the intended one, not more than one mail.

I've thoroughly checked and adjusted the settings of the Thunderbird client.

I hope the developer will find and offer the solution for it.

If anybody else too faced such and solved it, please let me know. Thank you.
creator: foenicxxx

content: Are you using a pop3 connection with your email provider's setting "leave a copy on the server" enabled? This might explain it.
creator: platform34

content:
Your mention your desktop connection is "via Bridge". This suggests your may be trying to connect Thunderbird for Android to a Proton Mail account.

Proton Mail is not supported by Thunderbird for Android. It would need a bridging app running on the phone to do the encryption/decryption. This app doesn't exist on Android, only Linux and Windows.

You need to use proton mail's official app on your phone.

If i'm misunderstanding, please clarify the mail provider your trying to setup!
creator: platform34

content:
Considering the Thunderbird email clients for Android and for desktop Windows, macOS, Linux are free to use and are not subscription based. Are you referring to one of the Mozilla products that is subscription based?

  • Mozilla VPN
  • Monitor
  • Firefox Relay
  • MDN Plus
